sen.j: 大徳寺納豆（だいとくじなっとう）は、京都市北区 (京都市)紫野の大徳寺門前で生産されている納豆である。
sen.e: Daitokuji natto is natto (fermented soybeans) made in Daitokujimonmae, Murasakino, Kita Ward, Kyoto City.
Daitokuji natto is natto (fermented soybeans) made in Daitokujimonmae, Murasakino, Kita Ward, Kyoto City.
Daitokuji natto is natto (fermented soybeans) made in Daitokujimonmae, Murasakino, Kita Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 納豆塩辛納豆（寺納豆）の一種。
sen.e: It is a kind of natto shiokara natto (tera natto).
It is a kind of natto shiokara natto (tera natto).
It is a kind of natto shiokara natto (tera natto).

sen.j: 納豆ではあるが、「納豆ひきわり納豆」のように粘り気があり、糸を引くような納豆とは異なる。
sen.e: It is different from sticky natto such as "natto hikiwari natto" (crashed natto).
It's different from sticky types of natto such as "natto hikiwari natto" (crushed natto).
It's different from sticky types of natto such as 'hikiwari natto' (crushed natto).

sen.j: 塩味の「塩辛納豆」の一種である。
sen.e: It is a kind of "shiokara natto" (soybeans fermented with komekoji (mold grown on rice) and salt).
It's a kind of "shiokara natto" (soybeans fermented with komekoji (mold grown on rice) and salt).
It's a kind of 'shiokara natto' (soybeans fermented with komekoji (mold grown on rice) and salt).

sen.j: その製法は、麹菌を発酵させ、乾燥後に熟成させたものである。
sen.e: Its manufacturing method is to ferment koji mold and after drying, mature it.
The manufacturing method used is to ferment koji mold and mature it once it has dried.
The manufacturing method used is to ferment koji mold and mature it once it has dried.

sen.j: 中国から日本に伝来した当初は、「豉」と呼ばれ、調味料として用いられたと考えられている。
sen.e: It is thought that when it was first introduced into Japan, it was called "shi" and used as seasoning.
It is believed that when it was first introduced into Japan it was called "shi" and used as a seasoning.
It is believed that when it was first introduced into Japan from China, it was called 'shi' and used as a seasoning.
sen.cmt: Japanの後にfrom China,を挿入しました。" "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 室町時代以後、ひきわり納豆と区別するため、「久喜」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Since the Muromachi period, it has been called "Kuki" to differentiate it from hikiwari natto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since the Muromachi period, it has been called "Kuki" in order to differentiate it from hikiwari natto.
Since the Muromachi period, it has been called 'Kuki' in order to differentiate it from hikiwari natto.

sen.j: 中国に渡航した僧が伝来したために、「寺納豆」とも呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: It has been also called "tera natto" (temple natto) because it was introduced by monks who went over to China.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It has also been called "tera natto (temple natto)" because it was introduced by monks who went over to China.
It has also been called 'tera natto' (temple natto) because it was introduced by monks who went over to China.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更し、()を' 'の外に移動させました。

sen.j: 大徳寺では、一休宗純が伝えたとされる。
sen.e: According to Daitoku-ji Temple, it is said to have been introduced by Sojun IKKYU.
According to Daitoku-ji Temple, it is said to have been introduced by Sojun IKKYU.
According to Daitoku-ji Temple, it is said to have been introduced by Sojun IKKYU.

sen.j: 他にも、「天竜寺納豆」・「一休寺納豆」、浜松市の「浜納豆」などが見られる。
sen.e: Other shiokara natto include "Tenryuji natto" (natto made in Tenryu-ji Temple), "Ikkyuji natto" (natto made in Ikkyu-ji Temple) and "Hama-natto" (natto made in Hamamatsu City).
Other shiokara natto include "Tenryuji natto" (natto made in Tenryu-ji Temple), "Ikkyuji natto" (natto made in Ikkyu-ji Temple) and "Hama-natto" (natto made in Hamamatsu City).
Other shiokara natto include 'Tenryuji natto (natto made in Tenryu-ji Temple), 'Ikkyuji natto' (natto made in Ikkyu-ji Temple) and 'Hama-natto' (natto made in Hamamatsu City).
